intro: Cyphostemma keilii, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by distinctive, elongated, horn-like fruits. Cyphostemma keilii is often found in rocky or arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its deep root system. Its ornamental value and resilience make it a popular choice for gardens in suitable climates.
